content: adapted from rowan s *esther ernie and enid easter chickens* this pattern is really cute but i just hate seaming i looked at the picture and this is my version in the round these are very basic instructions for knitting a chicken if you want a larger chicken cast on more stitches and knit more straight row in between your decrease row for the base and the chicken body each of my chickens are different i usually don t count row or stitches i just look at it and decide if it is time for a decrease row if you mirror your decreases your chicken won t be lopsided the tail is a great place to use up your scrap yarn you don t need much a yard or two and the more colorful the better just have fun
